ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: All the components, big and small, of producing a short film, directing actors, writing compelling stories/characters, workshopping your own and other people's scripts and projects, constructing a narrative through editing

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is flexible in nature, adjusting its timeline and structure depending on each class of students and the films they aspire to produce. Each session, there is enough opportunity for all students to talk about their projects and workshop not only creative ideas but also logistical/production issues. As is the nature of student filmmaking, we often act as producers for our films, even if we have another producer officially involved, so this dedicated time to talk through ideas, problems, and solutions is invaluable. Though it is a year-long course, with the first term dedicated to writing, I feel like it could benefit from encouraging pre-production earlier in the first term, even if it overlaps with later drafts of the writing.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. Jon cares about the success of every student's project, encourages collaboration, and facilitates a great workshop environment. That said, the class is what you make it. It requires an investment in your peers' work. If you are willing to bring a constructive and collaborative spirit to the class, you will meet trusted creative accomplices that will support your filmmaking at Yale and beyond.
